English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, about my bed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 내 침대 있잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): Your bed?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네 침대?

English (United States)(en-US): My bed, woven with resilience and\nsilk in the shadow of your bed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응. 네 침대의 그림자 속에서, 희멀겋지만\n탄력 있는 호흡으로 존재하는 나의 침대.

English (United States)(en-US): My sticky snug bed!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 끈적끈적하고 안락한 침대 말이야!

English (United States)(en-US): ‘… What does this mean.’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘… 이게 무슨 뜻일까.’

English (United States)(en-US): ‘… Oh, right. Dot’s using the cobweb\nin the corner as a bed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘… 아, 아아. 저 구석의 거미줄을\n뭉치가 침대로 쓰겠다 했었지.’

English (United States)(en-US): Right, Dot. Your bed. I remember.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 뭉치야. 네 침대. 기억했어.

English (United States)(en-US): Today I stumbled upon the\nartist who crafted the bed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘 그 침대를 만들어 준 예술가\n선생과 우연히 마주쳤어.

English (United States)(en-US): ‘Oh. No. Please, no…’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘세상에. 안 돼. 설마, 제발….’

English (United States)(en-US): The artist? You met the artist here?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 예술가 선생? 혹시\n우리 집에서 만난 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, yes. She was perched elegantly \non the windowsill over there.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 응. 그는 저쪽 창틀 위에\n고고하게 앉아 있었지.

English (United States)(en-US): ‘My worst fears are coming true.’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘오, 이런. 설마가 사람 잡았군.’

English (United States)(en-US): I came closer… and, with the utmost\nregard, counted her eight eyes,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 조금 가까이 다가가서… 실례를 범하지\n않았길 바라며, 그의 여덟 개나 되는 눈,

English (United States)(en-US): and her magnificent\neight legs one by one.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 경이롭게도 ‘역시’ 여덟 개나 되는\n다리를 하나하나 세어 보고 있었는데.

English (United States)(en-US): And then.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그때.

English (United States)(en-US): And then…?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그때…?

English (United States)(en-US): Our eyes met. Midair,\na little awkwardly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 눈이 마주친 거야. 허공에서,\n조금은 어색하게,

English (United States)(en-US): Her eight eyes and my\ntwo eyes locked together.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그의 눈알 여덟 개와\n나의 눈알 두 개가 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): She was much paler up close,\nwith glorious stripes! Very fluffy.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가까이에서 본 그는 훨씬 새하얀데,\n멋진 줄무늬도 있고! 아주 복실복실했어.

English (United States)(en-US): She even let me touch her fur.\nSweet as well as handsome.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 털을 만져보는 것도 허락해 주었지.\n근사한데 상냥하기까지.

English (United States)(en-US): And this is between you and me,\nbut she’s still on the windowsill.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이건 너와 나 사이의 귓속말인데,\n어, 그가 아직 창가에 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Right, so… So. She’s\nstill there, right now?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어, 어… 어? 저기 있다고, 지금?

English (United States)(en-US): The spider? Wait, no… the artist?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 거미가? 아니, 하하…\n예술가 선생이?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, that’s it, <nickname>. I’d like to\ngive her a thank-you present.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 응, <nickname>. 털을 만지게 해 준 답례로\n나도 선물을 주고 싶은데,

English (United States)(en-US): Can you see the resemblance?\nIt’s a token of my respect.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어때, 좀 닮았어? 그에\n대한 나의 존경을 담았어.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, sure. I know she’ll be thrilled.|I’m not sure what spiders find appealing.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오, 그럼. 그가 정말 기뻐할걸?|거미들의 취향은 잘 모르겠네.

English (United States)(en-US): What a relief. Thank you, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 한시름 놓을 수 있겠어. 고마워, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t blame you.\nYou are human, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아무래도 그럴 수 있겠다.\n<nickname>은 인간이니까.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll be back. Wish me luck!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다녀올게. 행운을 빌어 줘!

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, how splendid it must be, <nickname>
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 얼마나 황홀할까, <nickname>!

English (United States)(en-US): To soar across the blue sky and\nrace far beyond the clouds!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 푸르른 하늘을 가로지르며\n구름 너머로 내달리는 삶이란!

English (United States)(en-US): To be a child forever, free and whole,\nwith no chains binding me,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 날 묶어 두는 어떠한 족쇄도 없이,\n그저 나로서 자유롭게 영원한 아이가 되어

English (United States)(en-US): and live a life of adventuring and\nexploring and seeking every day!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 매일 매일을 행복하게 모험하고\n탐구하고 탐닉하기만 하며 살 수 있다면!

English (United States)(en-US): (This sounds familiar.)|(Where is this coming from.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (어디에서 들어 본 이야기다.)|(이게 대체 무슨 소리일까.)

English (United States)(en-US): Have you been reading\nwhat I think you have, Dot?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 혹시 뭉치, 어떠한 책을 읽은 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Do you mind me asking\nwhat this is about, Dot?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 혹시 뭉치, 지금 어떤 이야기를 하는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): I’ve been reading <Peter Pan>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <피터 팬>이라는 책을 읽게 되었어.

English (United States)(en-US): And like him, pure and merry and at times\ncruel, I won’t be burdened by anything!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 순수하고 쾌활한, 때로는 매정한 피터처럼\n난 그 어떤 것도 짊어지지 않으려 해!

English (United States)(en-US): And so forever a child I will be,\nwith nothing to lose.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래서 그 어떤 것도 잃을 수 없는,\n영원한 아이가 될 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): No more loss, pressure, anxiety,\nor agonizing troubles!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그곳엔 상실이 없을 거야, 압박도, 불안도,\n고통스러운 고민들도 없을 거야!

English (United States)(en-US): (Cheer Dot on.)|(Speak of reality.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (눈감고 뭉치를 응원한다.)|(뭉치에게 현실을 이야기해 준다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, the eternal child.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 영원히 아이 같은 뭉치.

English (United States)(en-US): You’re not human so it might be possible!\nI’d like to cheer you on.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 넌 인간이 아니니까 가능할지도 모르겠다! \n응원하고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): But if you remain innocent forever,\nwon’t you have to give up on being a dream?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 계속 지금의 천진한 뭉치로 남아\n있다면, 꿈 또한 될 수 없는 것 아니야?

English (United States)(en-US): Oh…? Oh…. Well…… Quite the unexpected\nand unfortunate outcome…….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어…? 어…. 어……. 그건 정말이지\n생각도 못한 불상사인데…….

English (United States)(en-US): (I was scared to grow up once too.)|(I couldn’t wait to grow up….)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (나도 어릴 땐 자라는 게 무서웠지.)|(나는 빨리 어른이 되고 싶었었는데….)

English (United States)(en-US): I was scared to grow up once too.\nI know how you feel.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도 어릴 땐 자라나고 싶지 않았어.\n너의 마음을 알아.

English (United States)(en-US): But Dot, growing up isn’t\nsomething to be afraid of!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 뭉치야, 자라나는 건\n생각만큼 두려워할 일이 아니야!

English (United States)(en-US): You know what, Dot? I couldn’t wait\nto grow up when I was young.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 그것 알아? 나는 빨리 어른이\n되고 싶어 하던 아이였어.

English (United States)(en-US): Growing up was so much\nmore exciting than I’d thought!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 자라나는 건 생각보다 신나는 일이었거든!

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe in books, but it’s hard\nto do so in the real world.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데 책 속이 아닌 실제의\n세계 속에서는 그러기 어려워.

English (United States)(en-US): All children grow,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모든 아이는 자라나기 마련이고,

English (United States)(en-US): and so will you, because you have\nsomething you want to achieve.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치 또한 이루고 싶은 꿈이 있으니까\n천천히 시간이 흐르며 자라나겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): Did you ‘grow’ too?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너 역시 ‘자라난’ 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Of course, I’m not a child anymore.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼, 나도 더 이상 어린 아이가 아니지.

English (United States)(en-US): I wasn’t happy at first either. I was\nno longer free to romp about the sky.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도 처음에는 아쉬웠어. 자라나기 위해\n하늘을 뛰노는 자유를 잃어야 하니까.

English (United States)(en-US): But in losing that freedom I gained \na different kind of strength.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 뛰노는 자유를 잃은 대신\n나에겐 또 다른 힘이 생겼어.

English (United States)(en-US): The power to do what?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 힘?

English (United States)(en-US): To decide for myself.|To define myself.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 스스로 결정을 내릴 수 있는 힘.|자신을 정의해 나갈 수 있는 힘.

English (United States)(en-US): The power to make decisions for myself\n without having to rely on others.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 누군가에게 의지할 필요 없이\n스스로 결정을 내릴 수 있는 힘.

English (United States)(en-US): And that power gave me responsibility,\nas well as a different form of freedom.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 힘은 곧 책임감과 또 다른\n모양의 자유를 동시에 쥐여 줬어.

English (United States)(en-US): Not like that of a naive child\nwith no responsibilities.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 책임 없이 마냥 뛰놀 수 있던\n아이의 자유와는 달라.

English (United States)(en-US): In a world where to gain something\nmeans to lose something
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하나를 얻기 위해 당연히\n하나를 잃어야 하는 세상 속에서

English (United States)(en-US): I’m free to decide what I’ll lose and gain,\nand free to face the consequences.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무엇을 얻고 잃을지를 나의 의지대로 선택하고,\n그 결과를 책임지고자 하는 자유지.

English (United States)(en-US): I didn’t know humans gained that kind of\n strength. Will I have it too someday?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들에게는 그런 힘이\n생기는구나. 나에게도 그럴까?

English (United States)(en-US): After I become a dream?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈이 된 후에?

English (United States)(en-US): Well….|Of course.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 글쎄….|그럼.

English (United States)(en-US): Well, we can’t say for certain just yet.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 글쎄, 미래를 확신할 수는 없겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): But some striking dreams would\nrock my day from start to finish.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 어떠한 강렬한 꿈들은\n나의 하루를 종일 뒤흔들기도 했어.

English (United States)(en-US): And others would echo in my\nmornings like gentle ripples.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아주 잔잔한 물결처럼\n아침을 울리던 꿈들도 있었지.

English (United States)(en-US): If you become a dream that echoes within,\nthat would mean you have that strength.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치가 울림을 주는 꿈이 된다면,\n힘이 생겼다고 말할 수 있을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Of course. The strength to determine\n someone’s morning.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼. 한 사람의 아침을 좌우할 수 있는 힘,

English (United States)(en-US): Wouldn’t you have the strength to leave a\n single blot on someone’s subconscious?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 한 사람의 무의식에 하나의 점을\n남길 수 있는 힘이 주어지지 않을까?

English (United States)(en-US): A single blot! Round like me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하나의 점! 동그란 나를 닮은?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, and a sticky one to boot.|Yes, one with eyebrows to boot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 이왕이면 끈적거리는 점.|응, 이왕이면 눈썹도 찍힌 점.

English (United States)(en-US): And you’re strong in your\nown way right now too.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 지금의 너에게도 힘이 있는 걸.

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t see it just yet….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아직은 보이지 않지만….

English (United States)(en-US): But it might be hiding\nsomewhere, like you said.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말 <nickname>의 말처럼\n어딘가에 숨어 있을지 몰라.

English (United States)(en-US): Pinned somewhere in my small black body….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 작고 검은 몸 사이에 꽂혀 있다거나….

English (United States)(en-US): Hm. Hmmm….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 으음. 으으으음….

English (United States)(en-US): I wonder how different I’ll be?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그때의 나는 어떻게 변해 있을까?

English (United States)(en-US): What freedoms will I have, and\nwhat responsibilities will I bear?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 자유를 누리며,\n어떤 책임을 지고 있을까?

English (United States)(en-US): The power to define myself infinitely.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 자신을 무한히 정의해 나갈 수 있는 힘.

English (United States)(en-US): Being an adult doesn’t mean\nyou’re done growing up.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어른이 되었다는 게 성장이\n끝났다는 뜻은 아니야.

English (United States)(en-US): You’ll be gifted with the opportunity\nto communicate with yourself,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 자신과 긴밀하게 소통하며\n진정으로 원하는 것을 찾아가는 기회,

English (United States)(en-US): discover what you truly want,\nand define yourself freely, every day.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 자유롭게 나를 정의해 나갈 수 있는\n기회를 매일 매일 선물받게 되거든.

English (United States)(en-US): It will be like a brand new\nchapter of your growth!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 성장의 새로운 챕터가\n시작되었다고 볼 수도 있을 거야!

English (United States)(en-US): It requires responsibility, but more than\nworth it. It’s that fun and exciting.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무거운 책임감이 부여되기도 하지만,\n그만큼 재미있고 벅차오르는 일이야.

English (United States)(en-US): I didn’t know humans gained that kind of\nstrength. Will I have it too someday?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들에게는 그런 힘이 생기는구나.\n나에게도 그럴까?

English (United States)(en-US): After I become a dream?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈이 된 후에?

English (United States)(en-US): Well….|Of course.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 글쎄….|그럼.

English (United States)(en-US): Well, we can’t say for certain just yet.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 글쎄, 미래를 확신할 수는 없겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): But some striking dreams would\nrock my day from start to finish.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 어떠한 강렬한 꿈들은\n나의 하루를 종일 뒤흔들기도 했어.

English (United States)(en-US): And others would echo my\nmornings like gentle ripples.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아주 잔잔한 물결처럼\n아침을 울리던 꿈들도 있었지.

English (United States)(en-US): If you become a dream that moves people,\nthat will mean you have that strength.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치가 울림을 주는 꿈이 된다면,\n힘이 생겼다고 말할 수 있을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Of course. The power to determine\nsomeone’s morning.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼. 한 사람의 아침을 좌우할 수 있는 힘,

English (United States)(en-US): Wouldn’t you have the power to leave a\nsingle blot on someone’s subconscious?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 한 사람의 무의식에 하나의 점을\n남길 수 있는 힘이 주어지지 않을까?

English (United States)(en-US): A single blot! Round like me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하나의 점! 동그란 나를 닮은?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, and a sticky one to boot.|Yes, one with eyebrows to boot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 이왕이면 끈적거리는 점.|응, 이왕이면 눈썹도 찍힌 점.

English (United States)(en-US): And you have power just now too.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 지금의 너에게도 힘이 있는 걸.

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t see it just yet….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아직은 보이지 않지만….

English (United States)(en-US): But it might be hiding\nsomewhere, like you said.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말 <nickname>의 말처럼\n어딘가에 숨어 있을지 몰라.

English (United States)(en-US): Pinned somewhere in my small black body….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 작고 검은 몸 사이에 꽂혀 있다거나….

English (United States)(en-US): Hm. Hmmm….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 으음. 으으으음….

English (United States)(en-US): I wonder how different I’ll be?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그때의 나는 어떻게 변해 있을까.

English (United States)(en-US): What freedoms will I have, and\nwhat responsibilities will I bear?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 자유를 누리며, 어떤 이름으로\n스스로를 부르고 있을까?

English (United States)(en-US): Constant growth, constant change.\nBut if there’s something I hold tight to,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 성장에 성장에 성장을, 변화에 변화를\n거듭하면서도 내가 꾹 쥐고 있는 게 있다면

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll be able to look at it and learn\nwhat matters most to me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그걸 바라보며 나에게 뭐가 제일\n소중한 것인지를 알아갈 수 있을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): And what matters most to me might be growth.|And maybe that’s what growth is.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 성장을 가장 소중히 여기게 될지도 몰라.|그것을 알게 되는 것이 바로 성장일지 몰라.

English (United States)(en-US): You’re right! Growing up might\nnot be so scary after all.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 맞아! 성장한다는 게 생각보다\n두려운 게 아닐지도 모르겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m still anxious…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 분명 불안해지지만…

English (United States)(en-US): but it’s a good kind of anxious,\nlike trembling butterflies.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지금의 떨림 안엔 설렘도 함께\n돌아다니는 것 같거든.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>. What was it like, when you,\nopened your eyes for the first time?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 처음으로 눈을 떴던 순간,\n넌 어떤 기분이었어?

English (United States)(en-US): When I opened my eyes for the first time?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 처음으로 눈을 떴던 순간?

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t understand.|What do you mean?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잘 이해가 안 돼.|그게 무슨 뜻이야?

English (United States)(en-US): When you came into this world, and,\nopened your eyes for the first time.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니까… 네가 세상에 태어나\n처음으로 두 눈을 뜨게 되었던 순간 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Looking back on that moment,,\nwhat do you see?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 순간은 어땠어? 너에게\n어떤 기억으로 남아 있어?

English (United States)(en-US): (Be honest.)|(Be playful.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (솔직하게 대답한다.)|(장난스럽게 대답한다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Well, to be honest, I can’t remember,\nwhat it was like at all.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음, 고백하지만 처음 눈을 떴던\n순간은 전혀 기억나지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): Foggy nothingness. Seems,\nI’ve misplaced that certain memory.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너무 오래 지난 일이라 살아오던\n길에 실수로 기억을 잃어버렸어!

English (United States)(en-US): But it was the first time the,\nworld flooded your senses!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 첫 숨을 틔워 내며 세계를\n온몸으로 감각한 순간인데도?

English (United States)(en-US): Such a powerful moment,,\nand you remember nothing? How?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그다지도 강렬하고 아름다운 찰나에\n 대한 기억이 없단 말이야? 어째서?

English (United States)(en-US): Humans periodically ‘forget’ things.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들에게는 주기적으로 ‘망각’이라는 것이 찾아와.

English (United States)(en-US): As in, we lose our memories.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 기억을 잃는다는 뜻인데,

English (United States)(en-US): So old memories either evaporate,\nor barely linger as vague images.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래서 아주 오랜 기억들은 대개 휘발되거나,\n어렴풋한 잔상으로나마 존재하게 돼.

English (United States)(en-US): Forgetting…. an unfamiliar concept,,\nbut one I’d like to comprehend.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 망각. 망각…. 생소하지만 이해하고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): I need time to absorb this.,\nI hope we’ll talk about ‘forgetting’ later.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 시간이 필요해. 나중에 다시 망각에\n대한 이야기를 나눌 수 있었으면 좋겠다.

English (United States)(en-US): Well…
What about you, Dot-who-doesn’t-forget?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치 너는?

English (United States)(en-US): What was it like to open,\nyour eyes for the very first time?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 망각 없는 너에게, 최초로 눈을 뜬\n순간은 어떠한 기억으로 남아 있어?

English (United States)(en-US): Share it with me?|Tell me. I’m curious.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 공유해 줄 수 있어?|이야기해 줘. 궁금해.

English (United States)(en-US): Alright. The very first time.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응. 내가 최초로 눈을 뜬 순간.

English (United States)(en-US): It was my first time experiencing life.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 처음 느껴 본 ‘생’의 감각이었어.

English (United States)(en-US): My first pair of eyeballs, too, so it took,\na while to get a good look at him.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 처음 가져 보는 눈알과 씨름하느라 그를\n제대로 살피기까지는 오랜 시간이 걸렸는데.

English (United States)(en-US): But when I finally did, I saw a silent,\nbut flickering body of heat.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 조금 적응이 되니 눈 앞에 고요하지만\n뜨겁게 일렁이는 형체가 보였어.

English (United States)(en-US): It was a boy with flaming red hair.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 불을 닮은 소년이었지.

English (United States)(en-US): A boy? Was he also a factory worker?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 소년? 그도 꿈 공장의 직원이었던 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): No. There must be moon people,\nabove the factory, but the ones I met
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니. 꿈 공장 위에도 달 사람들은\n살겠지만… 나와 함께 있던 이들은,

English (United States)(en-US): lived under the factory. Cleaning the,\nCrater where dream filth is discarded.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈 공장 아래에 살았어. 꿈 폐기물이\n버려지던 구덩이인 ‘크레이터’를 청소하며.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, I see.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 그렇구나.

English (United States)(en-US): (Crater Cleaners. I guess hierarchy,\nexists everywhere, even on the Moon.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (크레이터 청소부라니. 꿈 공장 위와\n아래의 풍경이 사뭇 다른가 보네….)

English (United States)(en-US): So did the fire boy help you open your eyes?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러면 그 불 소년이 네가 눈을\n뜨는 것을 도와주었던 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, <nickname>, I just knew.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, <nickname>, 직감적으로 알 수 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): From the chalk in his hands, I knew,\nhe was the one to drew me my eyes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 손에 분필이 들려 있었던 것으로 보아,\n나에게 눈을 그려 주었던 건 그였을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Draw you your eyes?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너에게 눈을 그려 준?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, I was nothing but a drop of filth,\non the floor… and he drew me my eyes!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 우연히 바닥에 떨어진 오물 방울에…\n그가 분필로 눈을 그려 주었어!

English (United States)(en-US): (Be impressed.)|(Be moved.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (신기해한다.)|(공감한다.)

English (United States)(en-US): (Not at all the human way, but then,\nagain Dot isn’t human. Fascinating.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (인간의 탄생 과정과는 매우 다르지만,\n뭉치는 인간이 아니니까. 정말 신선하다.)

English (United States)(en-US): (How sweet. Curious hands drew,\na pair of eyes and brought Dot to life.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (따뜻한 이야기야. 호기심 어린 손길로\n그린 눈 한 쌍이 뭉치를 ‘존재’하게 했구나.)

English (United States)(en-US): The first thing I felt as I looked,\nup at him was… warm.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그를 올려다보며 처음\n느꼈던 감각은 ‘따뜻하다.’

English (United States)(en-US): Not like a flame, but like\nembers among a heap of ashes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모닥불처럼은 아니지만, 타다\n남은 잿더미 속 불씨만큼은 따뜻했어.

English (United States)(en-US): As our eyes met, he startled before\nplacing me in the palm of his hand,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그는 나와 ‘눈’이 마주치자 아주 놀라며\n내 몸뚱이를 손바닥에 얹어 들어올렸고,

English (United States)(en-US): And I smelled something smoky…\nlike wild grass burning.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그때 그의 손에선 들풀\n타는 향이 났던 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): (Nod)|(Pat Dot on the head)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (고개를 끄덕인다.)|(머리를 쓰다듬어 준다.)

English (United States)(en-US): He looked at me and said,\n“Oh…? Oh! OH! Hi there.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 소년은 날 보며 “오…? 오! 오!!\n안녕?”이라는 말을 했고

English (United States)(en-US): I stared into his eyes with my eyes,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 내 두 눈알로 그의 두\n눈알을 한참 마주보다가

English (United States)(en-US): And I just knew—that\nI would remember his face,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그의 얼굴, 이 손바닥의 온기를 나는 아주,\n오래 기억하겠구나—직감했을 뿐이야.

English (United States)(en-US): and the warmth of his palms\nfor a very long time.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 나의 첫 번째 기억은 끝이 나.

English (United States)(en-US): That’s how my first memory ends.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 약 이삼 초의 시간이 지나고 난 후,

English (United States)(en-US): A few seconds later,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 엉덩이가 그의 따가운 촛불 같은,\n손 위에서 조금씩 녹아 내리려 하던 때에.

English (United States)(en-US): Just as my bottom was about to melt\nfrom the candle-like heat of his palm,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 주변으로 다른 이들이,\n몰려들어 조금은 소란해졌어.

English (United States)(en-US): people crowded around me\nand it became rather noisy.
That’s the end of this story.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 이 이야기의 끝이야.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>. Hello.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>. 안녕.

English (United States)(en-US): I can’t seem to sleep. I’m swathed in all\nthese thoughts crawling through my head.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잠이 잘 오지 않네. 머리를\n기어오르는 사념에 휘감겨 있느라.

English (United States)(en-US): … Could we talk? I might\nfeel better afterwards.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): … 이야기해 줄래? 대화하고\n나면 괜찮아질지 모르니까.

English (United States)(en-US): All filth has black in it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 불결한 모든 것에는 다 검정이 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): I thought it was only so on the Moon.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달에만 그럴까 싶었는데,

English (United States)(en-US): But it wasn’t. It’s the same on Earth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니었어. 지구에서도 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): What do you mean by that?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 무슨 말이야?

English (United States)(en-US): The Dark willingly hides\nthe most filthy and vile of beings.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 한 줄기 빛조차 들지 않는 암흑은 가장 불결하고\n불쾌할지 모르는 존재들을 기꺼이 숨겨 줘.

English (United States)(en-US): And becomes a symbol for them.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 그들의 상징이 돼.

English (United States)(en-US): Black cats and ravens, villains\nand devils. War, funeral, death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 흑묘와 까마귀, 악당과 악마.\n전쟁, 장례, 죽음.

English (United States)(en-US): All that is evil, fearful, painful, cursed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 악한 것, 두려운 것,\n고통스러운 것, 불운한 것.

English (United States)(en-US): They all lurk under\nthe blanket of the Dark.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 전부 암흑의 이불 아래 도사려.

English (United States)(en-US): And one day, on a peaceful afternoon\nwhen everyone least expects it,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러다 어느 날, 그 누구도 예상하지 못했던,\n아주 평화로웠던 어느 오후에

English (United States)(en-US): they will reach out to the sunlit world,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들은 양지의 세계로 손 뻗어,

English (United States)(en-US): and stain all that was\nbeautiful one by one.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아름다웠던 모든 것들을\n하나씩 오염시킬 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Slowly, sickeningly, and secretly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 느리게, 추잡하게, 그 누구도 모르게.

English (United States)(en-US): Calm down, Dot.|Nothing will happen.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 진정해, 뭉치야.|그런 일은 일어나지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): You’re safe. You have your own little corner,\nand a snug spiderweb bed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 넌 안전할 거야. 너만의 작은 모퉁이도 있고,\n아늑한 거미줄 침대도 있는걸.

English (United States)(en-US): And you have me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무엇보다 내가 있잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): The Dark can’t hurt you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 암흑은 너를 해칠 수 없을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): My dark corner, my snug\nweb, and not even you
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 어둑한 모퉁이도, 아늑한\n거미줄도, 심지어 너 역시

English (United States)(en-US): can’t keep me safe.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나를 지켜 줄 수 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): No, no, no. I became emotional\nand was careless…. I’m sorry.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니, 아니, 아니야. 감정에 휩쓸려\n실언을 했어…. 미안해.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m thankful that you’re here. But…\nit’s not that I am afraid of them.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 있다는 사실엔 감사하지.\n그러나… 난 그것들을 두려워하는 게 아니야.

English (United States)(en-US): I… I can’t be afraid of them.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난… 난 그것들을\n두려워하지 못하는걸.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s a part of me…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 날 구성하는…

English (United States)(en-US): The deep, sickening darkness of\nthat squelching filth…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 질척한 오물의 깊고,\n징그러운 암흑을….

English (United States)(en-US): And I…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 그걸…

English (United States)(en-US): Oh… oh.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아… 아.

English (United States)(en-US): I look at myself and I…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 어쩌면 나를, 나를…

English (United States)(en-US): Vile. Filthy.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 불쾌해. 불결해.

English (United States)(en-US): That’s the kind of black this is.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이건 그런 검정이야.

English (United States)(en-US): That’s… this is…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이건… 그런….
